what.title: What is a cookie?
what.content: A cookie is a small text file placed on your computer when you visit a website. It allows your browser to be recognized and retains certain information about your preferences or past actions.

essential.title: Essential cookies
essential.content: These cookies are necessary for the site to function. They allow you to navigate the site and use its essential features such as authentication and security.

performance.title: Performance cookies
performance.content: These cookies collect information about how you use our site, such as the most visited pages. This data helps us improve the site's operation.

functionality.title: Functionality cookies
functionality.content: These cookies allow the site to remember your choices (such as your username or language) and provide enhanced and more personalized features.

management.title: Cookie management
management.content1: You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can configure most browsers to prevent their placement.
management.content2: However, if you do this, you may need to manually adjust certain preferences each time you visit a site and some services and features may not work.

disable.title: How to disable cookies
disable.chrome: Chrome: Settings → Privacy and security → Cookies and other site data
disable.firefox: Firefox: Options → Privacy & Security → Cookies and Site Data
disable.safari: Safari: Preferences → Privacy → Manage Website Data
disable.edge: Edge: Settings → Cookies and site permissions → Manage and delete cookies

third.title: Third-party cookies
third.content: Some cookies may be placed by third-party services we use, such as Google Analytics to measure site audience. These third-party services have their own privacy policies.
